blocks.content:
Every year, HKN inducts two induction classes: one in fall, and one in winter. Induction into HKN is a powerful way to demonstrate your potential and accomplishments to your future employers and/or institutions.

If you have any questions about the induction process after viewing this page and the FAQ at the bottom, feel free to email us at [hkn.kappa.psi@gmail.com](mailto:hkn.kappa.psi@gmail.com).

## Overview

***

To officially induct into Eta Kappa Nu (Kappa Psi), inductees must:

1. Receive an email invitation.
2. Begin the induction process by filling out the Induction Start Form, and attending an Informational Session.
3. Accumulate 10 HKN points where one point is equivalent to about an hour of attending events.
4. Attend and pass an hour-long interview at the end of the induction cycle.
5. Attend the mandatory HKN Induction Ceremony, and pay the one-time $90 membership fee.

## Invitations

***

We send email invitations to all students meeting the requirements, **with the exception of COGS-ML majors**. _(If you are a COGS-ML major interested in inducting, please email us at [hkn@eng.ucsd.edu](mailto:hkn@eng.ucsd.edu))._

**GPA Cutoff:**

* top 1/3 of the senior standing or graduate class
* top 1/4 of the junior standing class
* top 1/5 of the sophomore standing class
* top 1/3 of graduate students in their department

**Eligible Majors:** ECE, CSE, MAE, BENG, DSC, MATH-CS, COGS-ML

## Requirements

***

To successfully become a full member of HKN, inductees must obtain a minimum of 10 points. Points can be obtained by attending or helping out with HKN events.

Points must come from the following categories:

| 1 point: Buddies 1-on-1 chat |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

* Meet with a current HKN officer and discuss the student leader experience.

| **1 point: Professional Development Workshop** |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

* Example Professional Development Workshops include Resume Workshops, Interview Workshops, Elevator Pitch Workshops, and Problem Solving Sessions.

| **1 point: Technical Event** |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

* Example Technical Events include hands-on workshops, intros to programming languages, and tech talks.

| **2 points: Social Events** |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

* Join social events to get to know other members of the chapter better, and meet other members of your induction class!

| 1 point: Outreach Event |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

* Assist our outreach program and experience HKN's influence on K-12 schools
* You can help give tours on campus at UCSD or assist teaching engineering basics at the K-12 schools.

The remaining 4 points can be obtained by any mix of info sessions, Professional Development Workshops, Social Events, Outreach Trips, volunteering at an HKN event, and more!

If you have questions about whether an event can count as a point, and/or what category an event lies under, feel free to email us at [hkn@eng.ucsd.edu](mailto:hkn@eng.ucsd.edu).

## Interviews and Induction

***

The formal interview is a 35-40 minute interview. It is composed of two parts, the **Behavioral** portion and the **Technical** portion.

* For the behavioral portion, be prepared to conduct yourself professionally (attire counts!) and answer some questions. Your resume will be required.
* For the technical portion, we test on material up through what is expected to be completed by Fall quarter of the inductee’s second year. Refer to your sample four-year plan([https://plans.ucsd.edu](https://plans.ucsd.edu "https://plans.ucsd.edu")) to view the minimum coursework we expect.

The **HKN (Kappa Psi) Induction Ceremony** is a ceremony declaring and celebrating your membership into Eta Kappa Nu, held during one evening at the UC San Diego Campus. This ceremony is mandatory to officially induct into HKN.

A one-time membership fee of $90 is required to induct into HKN Kappa Psi. This fee must be paid by the night of the Induction Ceremony, and covers the costs of the ceremony, HKN and IEEE membership, and T-shirt.

## Timeline

***

Every year, HKN inducts two classes of inductees from two induction cycles: the Fall-Winter Cycle, and the Winter-Sprint Cycle. Invitations for each cycle are sent out during Fall and Winter quarter, respectively.

Here is a general timeline for each cycle:

| **Fall-Winter Cycle** |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

Want to join HKN but not a university student?   
[See the official guidelines for inducting as a Professional.](https://hkn.ieee.org/professionals/ ) HKN at UCSD will be able to host the Induction Ceremony to appoint any nominated faculty.

## FAQ

***

| What is IEEE-HKN? |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

HKN is the official honors society for IEEE, the Institute for Electrical and Electronics Engineering.

| What does HKN do at UCSD? |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

HKN promotes academic excellence and professionalism of character among students at the Jacobs School of Engineering.  We develop students through tutoring, workshops, and mentoring.  Members enjoy development under our organization through networking, learning technical skills, and developing professionally.

We also provide free tutoring alongside ECE and other volunteer tutors at the IDEA Study Center on the 5th floor of Jacobs Hall (EBU1).

| What benefits come from membership? |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

* Job opportunities only for HKN members
* Alumni network and support
* Membership-only events
* Graduation stole and cord
* Access to HKN’s lounge
* One year of IEEE membership with induction
* Resume enhancement
* Mentoring
* Long lasting friendships with fellow members and alumni

| I am a graduate student. Can I induct into HKN? |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

Yes.  Any student currently enrolled in a program of study leading to the master’s or doctorate degree in a major under the ECE, CSE, MAE, or NANO departments, and has completed one full academic quarter at UC San Diego.

| I am a faculty member. Can I induct into HKN? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

All faculty of the ECE, CSE, NANO, and MAE departments with the rank of Assistant Professor or higher are eligible for membership.

| How do I complete my induction hours? |
| --- |
|  |
|  |

You can complete the hours required for induction by attending any HKN events, which can vary in time.

| How do I sign up for my induction interview? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

We will release a schedule of interview times to current candidates a few weeks before the induction ceremony.

| If I cannot finish my points this cycle, what should I do? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

You can complete your points next cycle. Generally, points from one cycle carry over to the next cycle only (not next next cycle). However, if you complete all 10 points in one cycle, all of your points will roll over to the next cycle.

| **I've completed my requirements in the first cycle, but couldn't complete my induction. Will my points carry over?** |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

Yes! Points may be carried over to the next induction cycle if not complete first cycle. However, points get cleared after each academic year, and a new invitation will be needed.

| Can I induct in the next cycle instead if I haven't completed the course requirement for my major? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

You need to receive a new invitation email again in order to induct in a later cycle.

| Do I need to attend the induction ceremony? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

Yes! You will become an official member ONLY after you attend an induction ceremony. You could attend a ceremony at a different HKN chapter (with our approval) if you cannot make it to our induction ceremony date.

| Do I get points for interviewing and attending the induction ceremony? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

No.

| Can I interview before completing the required  10 points? |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  |  |  |
|  |  |  |

Yes. You need to complete the 10 points by the day of the induction ceremony. However, note that you need to complete 6 points by winter (fall-winter cycle) / spring break (winter-spring cycle) in order to be eligible for interviews.

***

Any further questions? Email us at [hkn@eng.ucsd.edu](mailto:hkn@eng.ucsd.edu).
